DataElement.preferredName: Musculoskeletal Tumor Society Rating Scale Lower Extremity Supports Score 6 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of lower extremity supports, using a six-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Musculoskeletal Tumor Society Rating Scale Lower Extremity Supports Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A physician-completed measure used to assess extremity function in patients undergoing surgery for musculoskeletal cancer. The scale scores for function and acceptance by 6 variables for upper extremities and 6 variables for lower extremities._The bottom one of two._A question about the physical support that a person requires._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A physician-completed measure used to assess extremity function in patients undergoing surgery for musculoskeletal cancer. The scale scores for function and acceptance by 6 variables for upper extremities and 6 variables for lower extremities.

Concepts.definition: A physician-completed measure used to assess extremity function in patients undergoing surgery for musculoskeletal cancer. The scale scores for function and acceptance by 6 variables for upper extremities and 6 variables for lower extremities.

Property.preferredDefinition: The bottom one of two.:A question about the physical support that a person requires.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A question about the physical support that a person requires.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: MSTS Extremity Supports Score 6 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 0 (Two canes as crutches used) to 5 (None) on a Likert scale used on the Musculoskeletal Tumor Rating Scale questionnaire.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Two canes or crutches used (Always canes or crutches)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Two canes or crutches used (Always canes or crutches)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person always requires use of two canes or crutches.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person always requires use of two canes or crutches.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: One cane or crutch used most of the time

ValueMeaning.preferredName: One cane or crutch used most of the time
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person requires use of one cane or crutch most of the time.

Concepts.longName: Cane or Crutch Needed Most of Time
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person requires use of one cane or crutch most of the time.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intermediate (Occasional crutch or cane) - Between brace used most of the time and one cane or crutch used most of the time

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intermediate (Occasional crutch or cane) - Between brace used most of the time and one cane or crutch used most of the time
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person requires a level of support between occasional use of a brace and need for one cane or crutch most of the time.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person requires a level of support between occasional use of a brace and need for one cane or crutch most of the time.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Brace used most of the time

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Brace used most of the time
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person requires use of a brace most of the time.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person requires use of a brace most of the time.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intermediate (Occasional use of brace) - Between none and brace used most of the time

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intermediate (Occasional use of brace) - Between none and brace used most of the time
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person requires a level of support between none and occasional use of a brace.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person requires a level of support between none and occasional use of a brace.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person requires no physical support.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person requires no physical support.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
